import scipy.optimize # Chamando a biblioteca SCIPY OPTIMIZE 
import scipy.optimize as opt
import scipy.optimize as minimize
from scipy.optimize import linprog
from scipy.optimize import LinearConstraint, NonlinearConstraint
# https://docs.scipy.org/doc/scipy/reference/optimize.html

import numpy as np # Chamando a biblioteca NUMPY 
# https://numpy.org/doc/stable/reference/generated/numpy.array.html

import pandas as pd
# https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/reference/api/pandas.DataFrame.html?highlight=dataframe#pandas.DataFrame

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt # Chamando a biblioteca MATPLOTLIB para gerar gráficos 
# https://matplotlib.org/3.3.2/gallery/index.html

from mpl_toolkits.mplot3d import Axes3D # Chamando a biblioteca para gerar gráfico 3D
# https://matplotlib.org/3.1.1/api/_as_gen/mpl_toolkits.mplot3d.axes3d.Axes3D.html

from matplotlib import rcParams, cm # Com o comando rcParams, definimos por exemplo o tamanho da figura
# https://matplotlib.org/tutorials/introductory/customizing.html
# Com o comando cm, podemos escolher a cor do "dégradé" gerado no gráfico 3D

from sympy import * # Biblioteca para matemática simbólica
# https://www.sympy.org/pt/index.html

#import pyromat as pm
# http://www.pyromat.org/doc_intro.html # Propriedades Termodinâmicas no Python

# Gerando as fórmulas (online) no código LaTex no site WIRIS para developers:
# http://www.wiris.com/editor/demo/en/developers

%matplotlib inline
source.a2c5be61:
c = np.array([29,45,0,0])
A_ub = np.array([[1,-1,-3,0],[-2,3,7,-3]])
A_eq = np.array([[2,8,1,0],[4,4,0,1]])
b_ub = np.array([5,-10])
b_eq = np.array([60,60])
x0 = (0,None)
x1 = (0,6)
x2 = (-np.inf,0.5)
x3 = (-3,None)
bounds = [x0,x1,x2,x3]
result = linprog(c,A_ub=A_ub,b_ub=b_ub,A_eq=A_eq,b_eq=b_eq,bounds=bounds)
print(result)
source.ff4ac2f4:
c = [-1, 4]
A = [[-3, 1], [1, 2]]
b = [6, 4]
x0_bounds = (None, None)
x1_bounds = (-3, None)
res = linprog(c, A_ub=A, b_ub=b, bounds=(x0_bounds, x1_bounds),
              options={"disp": True})
print(res)
